channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: FDA advisors strongly back new Alzheimer’s drug, despite risks and limitations
item.description: Advisors to the Food and Drug Administration have recommended unanimously that the agency approve the Alzheimer’s drug donanemab.
item.content:encoded:
Advisors to the Food and Drug Administration have recommended unanimously that the agency approve the Alzheimer’s drug donanemab.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Wild elephants may have names that other elephants use to call them
item.description: Forget names like "Dumbo"—wild elephants appear to have their own unique names that other elephants use while talking to them in low rumbles.
item.content:encoded: Forget names like "Dumbo"—wild elephants appear to have their own unique names that other elephants use while talking to them in low rumbles.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Apple doubles down on artificial intelligence, announcing partnership with OpenAI
item.description: Apple has announced a much-anticipated partnership with OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT. The deal to bring AI features to iPhones and other devices is a major move for Apple, which has been slower than some competitors to jump on the AI bandwagon.
item.content:encoded:
Apple has announced a much-anticipated partnership with OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT. The deal to bring AI features to iPhones and other devices is a major move for Apple, which has been slower than some competitors to jump on the AI bandwagon.

(Image credit: Jeff Chiu/AP)
item.dc:creator: Lola Murti

item.title: Election Surprises and a Surprise Election in Europe
item.description: In European Parliamentary elections, 27 countries went to the polls and handed right-wing parties big gains. And in a surprising move, the president of France dissolved the country's parliament and called elections for the summer. We'll hear analysis of what this means for Europe and reaction from stunned French voters.
item.content:encoded: In European Parliamentary elections, 27 countries went to the polls and handed right-wing parties big gains. And in a surprising move, the president of France dissolved the country's parliament and called elections for the summer. We'll hear analysis of what this means for Europe and reaction from stunned French voters.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Venezuelan family traveled for 3 months, only to be denied asylum claim at the border
item.description: President Joe Biden’s executive actions that temporarily halts most asylum claims at the southern border is leaving many immigrant families in limbo, hoping they’ll be eligible to reunite with their loved ones.
item.content:encoded:
President Joe Biden’s executive actions that temporarily halts most asylum claims at the southern border is leaving many immigrant families in limbo, hoping they’ll be eligible to reunite with their loved ones.

(Image credit: Michelle Jokisch Polo/ WKAR)
item.dc:creator: Michelle Jokisch Polo

item.title: The Rev. James Lawson, key architect of the Civil Rights Movement, dies at 95
item.description: Martin Luther King Jr. called civil rights pioneer, the Rev. James Lawson, the leading theorist and strategist of nonviolence.
item.content:encoded:
Martin Luther King Jr. called civil rights pioneer, the Rev. James Lawson, the leading theorist and strategist of nonviolence.

(Image credit: Kevork Djansezian)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: The U.N. Security Council endorses U.S. cease-fire plan to end the war in Gaza
item.description: The council voted 14-0 to support President Biden’s step-by-step plan for a cease-fire, an exchange of hostages and prisoners and an end to the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
The council voted 14-0 to support President Biden’s step-by-step plan for a cease-fire, an exchange of hostages and prisoners and an end to the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: U.S. Ambassador to U.N. on the Security Council's vote for a ceasefire in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Noah Caldwell

item.title: A law in Vermont makes fossil fuel company pay for damages from climate change
item.description: Vermont is the first state in the nation to adopt a superfund-style law for major oil companies. It lets the government take action to recoup climate-related damages.
item.content:encoded: Vermont is the first state in the nation to adopt a superfund-style law for major oil companies. It lets the government take action to recoup climate-related damages.
item.dc:creator: Abagael Giles

item.title: Moore High's graduating class of 74' finally walks
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller
